q: Crown Prosecution Service( CPS) has asked a senior QC to "comprehensively" re-examine material amassed as part of the original inquiry and any new evidence. In his resignation statement, Mr Andy Coulson said: Nothing is more important than the Government's task of getting this country back on its feet. "Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110% needed in this role. Speaking to reporters later, Mr David Cameron said he had done an "excellent, excellent job" as his communications chief. in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

Is Larry Page the Visionary CEO Google Needs? Now what about Google? Here's what I said late last year when I declared Google Buzz tech's biggest flop of 2010: With Google's biggest attempt at social now a mere afterthought, nothing stands in Facebook's way. The social network will eventually surpass its Silicon Valley rival both in terms of net worth and dominance of the web. Google will become the next Microsoft, profitable but unable to grow, and Facebook will become the next Google whose influence will be felt for years to come. Now, more than ever in its history, does Google need a visionary leader in the mold of Mark Zuckerberg or Steve Jobs . Eric Schmidt , while one of the best CEOs and managers of all time, is
